metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14158 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.Description: Scrapy 1.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via large files because arbitrarily many files are read into memory, which is especially problematic if the files are then individually written in a separate thread to a slow storage resource, as demonstrated by interaction between dataReceived (in core/downloader/handlers/http11.py) and S3FilesStore.

notes.Note: msalvatore> no upstream fix as of 2019-03-06

criterions.comment: python-scrapy package in hirsute is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2019-06-06').
